summary: Diff adds a new /industries standalone page, updates TopNav to route "Industries" to /industries, adds an Industries lead-gen form using the existing useLeadSubmission hook, and expands backend lead storage/API to accept additional fields. However, the Industries page copy/structure appears not to match the user-provided verbatim content requirements, and some required Industries-page elements cannot be confirmed due to truncation.

missing_requirements.requirement: All headings, subheadings, bullets, and CTA labels match the user-provided content verbatim (English user-facing text) across the Industries We Serve page sections.

missing_requirements.requirement: Render all Industries page sections in the exact specified order, including four industry blocks with labeled subsections (Common Challenges / What We Implement / Outcome), consistency section, qualifying section, lead-gen section, final CTA block, and a short Caffeine AI prompt block.

missing_requirements.requirement: A final block exists at the bottom containing a short Caffeine AI prompt, displayed as plain text with an obvious copy-to-clipboard interaction.
missing_requirements.reason: A copy-to-clipboard handler exists, but the prompt text shown is long and appears to be an instruction to generate the page (not clearly the requested 'short' prompt presented as a final page block). The actual on-page rendering of this block at the bottom is not visible in the truncated content.

missing_requirements.reason: The IndustriesLeadGenForm file is truncated before the submit button and any below-CTA small text; there is no visible evidence that the button label and the required small text are implemented.

missing_requirements.requirement: Final CTA "Book Strategy Call" exists on the Industries page and triggers the existing strategy call behavior (mailto).
missing_requirements.reason: IndustriesPage imports bookStrategyCall, but the final CTA block and button wiring are not visible in the truncated IndustriesPage content, so implementation cannot be confirmed.
